quotes: Rest your eyes on the horizon. Your screen will wait.
Nature never hurries, yet everything is accomplished.
Look far, think deep, rest well.
Your eyes work hard. Give them a moment of peace.
The mountains are calling. Look toward them.
Twenty seconds of rest, twenty hours of clarity.
Let your gaze wander where your feet cannot.
Eyes on the distance, mind at ease.
A moment away from the screen is a gift to yourself.
Look beyond the glass. The world is still there.
The best view is the one that lets your eyes breathe.
Somewhere outside, a tree is waiting for your gaze.
Your eyes deserve a vacation, even if just for seconds.
The sky doesn't have pixels. Look up.
Give your eyes the gift of distance.
Blink. Breathe. Look away. Repeat.
The world in focus starts with eyes at rest.
Let the horizon hold your attention for a moment.
Your screen will remember where you left off.
A wandering gaze is a resting gaze.
The farthest point you can see is where your eyes relax.
Step back from the pixels. Embrace the infinite.
Your eyes are not machines. Let them rest.
Look out the window. Adventure awaits your gaze.
Twenty feet away, clarity begins.
The best breaks are the ones your eyes take.
Screens are temporary. Your vision is forever.
Find something green. Your eyes will thank you.
The distance is calling. Answer with your gaze.
Rest now, see better later.
